alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT/445 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado and northwest Kansas, including the following counties, in northeast Colorado, Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne. * WHEN...Until 345 PM MDT /445 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM MDT /200 PM CDT/, Trained weather spotter reports very heavy rainfall around 4 inches of rain in western portions of Cheyenne county. Portion of roadway 0.5 miles north of Hwy 36/385 has 6-12 inches of water over it - This includes the following streams and drainages... Plum Creek, Cowpe Creek, Hackberry Creek, Battle Creek, Arikaree, South Fork Republican River, Cherry Creek, Fish Creek, SF Republican, Crosby Creek, West Fork Sand Creek, Sand Creek, Arikaree River, Spring Creek and Drury Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Francis. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
